Bulger jury selection begins

The process is underway in selecting jurors for the trial of James "Whitey" Bulger, the notorious Boston gangster accused of committing 19 murders and a host of other crimes. Pictured, Bulger was transported to federal court this morning. (9:56 a.m.)
  • Survey Would you want to serve on the jury? | Watch Bulger in court pre-trial | Complete coverage

Bentley University athlete collapses, dies

Police said Joe Glynn a two-time Globe All-Scholastic from Cardinal Spellman High, died after collapsing at a recreational summer league game in Watertown. (8:54 a.m.)

Police: US woman was gang-raped in India

Police said a 30-year-old woman who was hitchhiking in the resort town of Manali was raped by men who picked her up in a truck. (10:28 a.m.)
  • India city to ban lingerie mannequins to stop rape
Game 2: Bruins 6, Penguins 1

Road warriors: Bruins take two in Pittsburgh

A four-goal first period helped the Bruins skate past the Penguins on Thursday night and gain a two-game advantage in the East finals.

Oh baby, JetBlue pilot takes jab at Crosby

A crying baby on a Pittsburgh-to-Boston flight today inspired the pilot to take to the intercom and talk smack about Penguins captain Sidney Crosby. Several Boston media members were on board.

    UN: More evidence needed on Syria chemical weapons
